p: African tick-bite fever. African tick-bite fever is a spotted fever group rickettsiosis caused by Rickettsia africae and transmitted by Amblyomma ticks [125]. It is known to be endemic in Zimbabwe and South Africa, although based on serologic surveys the infection also occurs elsewhere in SSA [125], [126]. Infection with R. africae is common in travelers returning to Europe and North America [125], [126].
